intro: Wormskioldia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian wormskioldia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Wormskioldia abyssinica is often found in high-altitude regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
